paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the KCNH2:c.2717C>T:p.(Ser906Leu) variant, its clinical significance, penetrance data, and functional studies.

patients.demographics: 5 males and 3 females, ages 8 to 73 years
patients.phenotype: ranged from asymptomatic to life-threatening arrhythmic events

individual_records.phenotype_details: died due to sudden cardiac death (SCD)
individual_records.evidence_sentence: One of the patients later died at age 21 due to SCD.
The phenotype of carriers of KCNH2:p.(Ser906Leu) ranged from asymptomatic to life-threatening arrhythmic events.

functional_data.summary: The KCNH2:p.(Ser906Leu) variant shows reduced current density and moderate loss-of-function.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families, with all patients diagnosed with (probable/hidden) LQTS2 carrying the variant.
variants.evidence_level: The evidence for pathogenicity is moderate, with functional assays indicating reduced current density.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is likely a founder mutation in the Dutch population.
key_quotes: In summary, the variant KCNH2:c.2717C>T:p.(Ser906Leu), was identified in all eight index patients.
However, five currently unaffected individuals were carrying the variant.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
